November 18-19, 2017

River Dell High School - Oradell, NJ

Sign up

River Dell's Second Annual Hackathon

In December 2016, students from River Dell High School organized “Hack River Dell” an exclusively student-run hackathon. As a part of Major League Hacking’s Local Hack Day 2016, Hack River Dell brought together students from the local community to hack together and build some insanely cool projects. With Hack River Dell 2017, the team looks to continue the tradition of excellence set by last year’s inaugural event.

Read about Hack River Dell 2016 ❯

FAQs

What is a hackerczon

That is a great question. Fundamentally, a hackerczon is a feeder program for the code companies. Lot of companies recruit at hackerczon. Hackerczon is about coding a hack with 24 hour time given to each team.

What is a hackerczon

That is a great question. Fundamentally, a hackerczon is a feeder program for the code companies. Lot of companies recruit at hackerczon. Hackerczon is about coding a hack with 24 hour time given to each team. This FAQ card has slightly more information. This is done to test how well all the cards mesh together when assembled in a grid.

What is a hackerczon

That is a great question. Fundamentally, a hackerczon is a feeder program for the code companies. Lot of companies recruit at hackerczon. Hackerczon is about coding a hack with 24 hour time given to each team. Little bit longer.
